s.text: Unlike the distributions observed for bladder and external urethral sphincter [ 10 ] where there was considerable overlap as well as a large number of double-labeled neurons, the results for bladder and prostate in this work are quite different.

Unlike the distributions observed for bladder and external urethral sphincter [ 10 ] where there was considerable overlap as well as a large number of double-labeled neurons, the results for bladder and prostate in this work are quite different.

Speculation suggests some form of control of the volume or composition of the secretion [ 3 ] . There is also evidence for the presence of periprostatic ganglia and capsular ganglia respectively outside and inside the prostatic capsule [ 4 ] but not much is known about their pharmacology or function.
